paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses genetic variants in BRCA1, BRCA2, and NOD2 in relation to pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer. No specific BRCA2 variants were found in the study population, but other non-pathogenic variants were identified in patients with pancreatic diseases.

patients.phenotype: Mostly acute pancreatitis, one with pancreatic cancer, one with another pancreatic disease

functional_data.summary: No specific functional assays were mentioned for these variants.

variants.additional_notes: The variants identified in BRCA2 were not the primary focus of the study and were found incidentally.
key_quotes: In the case of BRCA1 and BRCA2, we did not identify the studied single nucleotide polymorphisms in any sample.
Within these polymorphisms, 4 different ones have been identified for BRCA2 (rs80358475, rs28897710, rs56328701, rs2137474144).

tables_processed.table_caption: The allele frequency in study group and global and European population according to NCBI database.

challenges: The paper did not report any pathogenic BRCA2 variants, only nonpathogenic ones were found incidentally.
extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction focused on BRCA2 variants, and no pathogenic variants were reported in the study population.
